p: Fern et al. [ 127] have extensively reported on the usages of P. nigrum as a stimulating expectorant in traditional Western and Ayurvedic medicines, and as a tranquilizing and anti-emetic in traditional Chinese medicine. Morevoer, the seed is applied internally in Western herbalism to treat indigestion and wind, and in Chinese medicine to treat stomach chills, food poisoning, cholera, dysentery, diarrhoea and vomiting caused by cold. Furthermore, P. nigrum is used externally in Ayurvedic medicine to treat nasal congestion, sinusitis, epilepsy and skin inflammations with the EO used to ease rheumatic pain and toothache.
